meanings.definition: To put or place something into something else
meanings.sent1: She was inserting the key into the lock.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys inserting colorful blocks into the toy box.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was inserting acorns into the ground like a little gardener.
meanings.sent4: The artist was inserting emotions into her painting, making it come alive.
meanings.sent5: Inserting the final puzzle piece felt incredibly satisfying.

meanings.definition: To add something into a document or text
meanings.sent1: The student was inserting a new paragraph into his essay.
meanings.sent2: She always double-checks before inserting any new information into the report.
meanings.sent3: The detective was inserting clues into the case file, hoping to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His words were like inserting a splash of color into the black and white document.
meanings.sent5: Inserting a footnote can provide additional context for the reader.

meanings.definition: To introduce something into a conversation or discussion
meanings.sent1: She was inserting a new topic into the meeting agenda.
meanings.sent2: He kept inserting jokes into the serious discussion, lightening the mood.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was inserting witty remarks into the conversation, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her unique perspective was like inserting a fresh breeze into the stale debate.
meanings.sent5: Inserting a controversial idea can spark a lively debate.
